name: AnnualReportingPolicy
definition: Reports are presented once a year
label: annual reporting policy

name: ReportingFrequencyPolicy
label: reporting frequency policy
definition: Frequency with which financial reports will be presented.

name: PortfolioBenchmark
label: portfolio benchmark
definition: Security or other price against which the performance of the portfolio is evaluated.

name: AssetClassStrategy
explanatoryNote: EFAMA: The type of securities or other holdings that may be invested in. FIBIM: Strategy which is asset class based. Can implement this in terms of a classification of those things. Wording implies this is a policy.
definition: Strategy which is asset class based.
label: asset class strategy

name: FundPortfolioInvestmentLimitations
definition: Detailed Policy on approximately how the portfolio is to be allocated to achieve the stated investment goals. This underpins the detailed strategy of how to achieve this.
explanatoryNote: Defined as "Strategy" in FIBIM and elsewhere. WG11: Rough allocation of the portfolio.
label: fund portfolio investment limitations

name: FondsCommunDePlacement
label: fonds commun de placement
definition: open-ended collective investment fund, which is a contractual form set up between the fund manager and investors and not a separate legal entity

name: CollectiveInvestmentVehicle
explanatoryNote: From EFAMA DD: The word fund can refer to either an investment pool, umbrella or share class, and is commonly refered to as a collective investment vehicle (can have ISIN or not). The meaning here is for the investment pool (of which an Umbrella fund is also one such) and not to the share class.

name: FundsProcessingAccount
label: funds processing account
definition: An account used specifically in the processing of funds. Like all accounts this is (per FIBIM definition) a business relationship between two entities; one entity is the account owner, the other entity is the account servicer. Please refer to Financial global model for treatment of accounts relationships in this model.
explanatoryNote: Derived from FIBIM definition for "Account", which is: "Business relationship between two entities; one entity is the account owner, the other entity is the account servicer." this corresponds to the Global Terms definition for Account.

name: InvestmentAdvisor
label: investment advisor
definition: The party that provides investment guidance at a fee. Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: FundsProcessingParty
definition: party involved in the processing of funds
label: funds processing party

name: PortfolioManager
definition: person or entity responsible for day to day investment decisions for a fund or asset
label: portfolio manager

name: FundDividendPolicy
definition: Terms for the expected distributions of dividends.
label: fund dividend policy

name: FundCashDistributionPolicy
definition: Policy for distribution of cash dividends or notes in the event that the fund units have a distribution policy of "Cash" rather than "Reinvestment".
label: fund cash distribution policy

name: FundsProcessingPassport
definition: The Funds Processing Passport. This is defined as a document. This has terms drawn from elsewhere in the model which are defined as part of the FPP for reasons defined in the FPP descriptions.
label: funds processing passport

name: FundReinvestmentPolicy
label: fund reinvestment policy
definition: Terms for the expected reinvestment of profits on fund units.

name: FundUnitDistributionPolicy
definition: policy relating to the unit, e.g. if income is paid out or retained in the fund and how this is treated, including distribution policy details for dividends and coupons.
label: fund unit distribution policy

name: FundRedemptionTerms
label: fund redemption terms
definition: Formal terms for redemption of units in the fund. These set out what the investor and the fund may or may not do.

name: FundProcessingTerms
definition: Formal terms for processing of the fund. These set out what the investor and the fund may or may not do. These include terms for redemption and subscription processing as well as general processing terms. ISO FIBIM definition: Processing characteristics linked to the instrument, ie, not to the market.
explanatoryNote: These include Fund Subscription Terms, Fund Redemption Terms. and terms which relate to general processing and restrictions or otherwise on the holder. FPP notes: FPP presentation identifies many of these terms under the heading of Valuation Dealing characteristics. May need to revise which goes where in line with FPP. See also terms under NAV Valuation Calculation Method. Others of these terms appear in FPP under Instrument Restrictions. These cover the subscription, redemption and holding amounts and units and minimum holding period.
label: fund processing terms

name: SPVPurpose
label: s p v purpose
definition: The reason for the creation of a Special Purpose Vehicle.

name: PerformanceDeterminationMethod
definition: A method for performance determination (e.g. Time weighted and money weighted, annualized, gross of fee) along with the time frame in which this is determined. PLUS Performances NamePeriod
label: performance determination method

name: NetAssetValueCalculationMethod
label: net asset value calculation method
definition: Parameters for the calculation of the net asset value for an investment fund/fund class.

name: FundProcessingForm
label: fund processing form
definition: The form of documentation or control mechanism required for some funds processing activity.
explanatoryNote: Equates to the "Physical Form" in SIO FIBIM for certain activities in funds processing. May or may not be a written physical document. ISO FIBIM Definition: Specifies whether a physical form is required.

name: EquityPortfolio
label: equity portfolio
definition: A portfolio which has at least 85% exposure to shares.

name: FundPortfolio
label: fund portfolio
definition: An account containing a number of financial instruments along with cash positions in one or more currencies and belonging to a Fund

name: ReferToFundOrderDesk
definition: Restriction requiring an investor to refer to the fund order desk prior to redeeming a fund.
label: refer to fund order desk

name: PortfolioInvestmentStrategy
definition: The manner in which the portfolio manager tries to reach the funds objectives.
explanatoryNote: Describes how you get there. E.g fully invested v not fully invested. MB Note: The terms labeled "Strategy" in EFAMA and in FIBIM are more like dictionary definition of policy, while "How you get there" is a dictionary definition of Strategy. Therefore original labels may be reversed from dictionary definition of the global semantics these are derived from.
label: portfolio investment strategy

name: InvestmentStrategy
definition: plan, method, or series of maneuvers or stratagems for obtaining a specific investment goal
label: investment strategy

name: FundOrderDesk
label: fund order desk
definition: The Fund Order Desk is a party to the Fund Order Desk Account.

name: KeyInvestorInformationDocument
label: key investor information document
explanatoryNote: Key investor information shall include appropriate information about the essential characteristics of the UCITS concerned, which is to be provided to investors so that they are reasonably able to understand the nature and the risks of the investment product that is being offered to them and, consequently, to take investment decisions on an informed basis.
definition: short document that provides critical information for investors, summarizing content derived from a prospectus such that it can be understood by investors without reference to other documents, as required by law in the European Union

name: FundProcessingGeneralTerms
definition: Formal terms for general processing of the fund. These set out what the investor and the fund may or may not do.
label: fund processing general terms

name: FundSupervisoryAuthority
label: fund supervisory authority
definition: party that supervises the fund or fund industry

name: FundDataProvider
label: fund data provider
definition: A party which supplies market data to a fund.

name: FundSubscriptionTerms
definition: Subscription terms for the fund. Further notes: ISO FIBIM, EFAMA DD and FPP combine terms for subscription, redemption and general holding requirements. These have been separated here as they are different kinds of term, but this can be reviewed. Subscription Terms are identified as terms of the fund and not the fund unit, since terms for how you might subscribe can't be binding one someone who has not yet subscribed.
label: fund subscription terms

name: FundAccountant
label: fund accountant
definition: The party that keeps accounting records of the available assets and liabilities of the Fund. It calculates dealing prices, the Net Asset Value (NAV) of the Fund, and may provide fund performance and tax data. Can be subcontracted by the FundAdministrator.

name: OrganizationStrategy
definition: Strategy which is organization based.
label: organization strategy

name: FundInvestmentObjective
label: fund investment objective
definition: The aim of a Fund e.g outperfom a given benchmark.

name: FundInvestmentPolicy
label: fund investment policy
explanatoryNote: EFAMA Note: Model distinguishes between strategy (what you intend to invest in) and portfolio structure (what is held). This semantics matches the EFAMA DD "Fund Investment Policy" No stated definition in EFAMA DD ("Further discussion required").
definition: policy that the fund implements in order to achieve the stated fund objectives

name: TimeWeightedRateOfReturnPerformanceDeterminationMethod
label: time weighted rate of return performance determination method
definition: Time weighted rate of return.

name: Liquidity
definition: Precise definition needed for liquidity, and check that it is modeled accordingly.
label: liquidity

name: FundUnit
explanatoryNote: If it is a closed fund, you can still trade the units. You trade back with the fund. Not with a counterparty. Therefore this is a tradable contract, though it may not necessarily be a transferable contract.

name: NoteFundUnit
definition: Need a legal definition - to follow. This is one of the mechanisms by which an investor may hold an interest in a fund, but is not a Bond or a Share.
label: note fund unit

name: FundProspectus
definition: The Prospectus for the Fund. This is a document made available publicly for potential investors. It will include facts about the fund investment objective, investment focus and other details of the fund. Some of this information becomes binding on the fund once it is issued, while other information is guidelines only.
label: fund prospectus

name: SectorStrategy
definition: Strategy which is sector based.
label: sector strategy

name: StakeInFund
label: stake in fund
definition: The holding of some portion in a fund, by some party. This stake will generally tak ethe form of some sort of unit in that fund.

name: FundDistributor
label: fund distributor
definition: an entity through which a fund may be bought by or for an investor. This may be on a discretionary or advisory basis, or as an execution-only service. Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: FundCouponPolicy
definition: Terms for the expected distribution of bond unit coupons.
label: fund coupon policy

name: DebtStakeInFund
definition: A stake held in a fund by way of a Bond Unit.
label: debt stake in fund
explanatoryNote: Note that you cannot buy fractional amounts in a bond. Review Session Note: Similar to what happens in a CDO where the collaterial manager and the issuer are two different entities. So model this along the same lines as the SPV in the structured finance model. Therefore: further modeling and review required

name: SpecialPurposeVehicle
explanatoryNote: A Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) set up specifically to issue a security or securities. It is set up by a company or a group of companies for some purpose such as to create instruments that are off the company's balance sheet or to issue Participation Notes for investors in another jurisdiction. The SPV is formed for a specific reason and exists for a specific period of time and is then disbanded. Further notes: Special Purpose Vehicles are also referred to as bankruptcy remote entities, as they isolate financial risk. For Participation Notes: slightly different purpose but the same kind of vehicle. The only investment made by the SPV is that they buy in the stock. These are the same kind of entity in all of the contexts in which they exist.

name: FundClassificationScheme
label: fund classification scheme
definition: A published scheme for the category of a fund according to the asset class.

name: FundAuditor
label: fund auditor
definition: The party that is in charge of examining and verifying a fund's financial and accounting records as well as supporting documents and fulfilment of legal requirements. Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: FundReportingTerms
label: fund reporting terms
definition: Terms describing the accounting methods and reporting arrangements used by the fund.

name: FundClassification
label: fund classification
definition: The category of the fund according to the asset class. This is a published code by which the Fund is classified. Further notes: Could be EFCF codes. This is the way in which "Type of fund" is articulated.

name: AccumulatingShareClass
explanatoryNote: This fact would be determined by the fund unit having a specific Fund Distribution Policy of Accumulating.
definition: A share class in which there is no option to reinvest.
label: accumulating share class

name: FundShareClassUnit
definition: The legal structure in which you can purchase part of an investment pool, defined by a variety of characteristics like investor type, minimum size of investment, distribution type, fee and currency. A fund unit which gives the holder an equity stake in the fund.
label: fund share class unit
explanatoryNote: From review sessions: Theoretically you can buy a fraction of a share in a fund. This would depend on the legal structure of the fund, e.g. a minimum investment. There is always a distribution plan.

name: EquityFund
definition: A fund which invests in at least 85% shares.
label: equity fund

name: InvestmentRestriction
explanatoryNote: These are defined by the overall Fund investment policy. Not the same as the detailed policies for investing in percentages of this or that.
definition: Limitations that apply to the fund as a whole, such as risk factors. these are used to determine whether the fund is appropriate for a given type of investor to invest in.
label: fund investment restrictions set

name: FundAdministrator
explanatoryNote: If the unit is a bond, then the issuer is separate from the Fund Administrator. WG11 text: The party in charge of financial accounting, NAV calculation, management and performance fee calculation. Can also be in charge of orders centralisation and registration. Definition origin:EFAMA DD
definition: Entity that has to fulfil the legal and supervisory requirements of the fund. Responsible for all the business purposes around the investment pool, and so is reponsible for the issuing of the shares.
label: fund administrator

name: FundPromoter
label: fund promoter
definition: An entity that promotes a fund. May be an investor, pension fund, bank, insurance company or management company

name: FundContract
explanatoryNote: From ISO FIBIM "Umbrella Fund" narrative: In securities, a collective investment scheme that has a contractual or a corporate form. When it has a contractual form, a fund is constituted under either the law of contract or under the trust law and thus it is not a legal entity. In its corporate form, a fund is a legal entity and is structured as a company.

name: FundManager
label: fund manager
definition: The party that sets up the fund, decides the investment strategy, appoints the agents, and is responsible for the promotion and the marketing of the fund. It makes all of the important decisions related to the fund. Also called fund promotor or fund sponsor. This is a dupliucate of Fund Management Company at the moment

name: SemiAnnualReportingPolicy
definition: Reports are presented twice a year.
label: semi annual reporting policy

name: FundBondUnitCoupon
definition: A fixed coupon paid out to holders of the Fund Bond Unit.
label: fund bond unit coupon

name: FundLegalFormDocumentation
definition: For a fund which is constituted under the law of contract, the constitution or articles that define the fund. These are embodied in a Contract.
explanatoryNote: From ISO FIBIM "Umbrella Fund" narrative: In securities, a collective investment scheme that has a contractual or a corporate form. When it has a contractual form, a fund is constituted under either the law of contract or under the trust law and thus it is not a legal entity. In its corporate form, a fund is a legal entity and is structured as a company.
label: fund legal form documentation

name: UnitIssuer
label: unit issuer
definition: The party which issues the Fund Unit.

name: BricksAndMortarHolding
definition: A holding of built property.
label: bricks and mortar holding

name: IncomeAccumulation
label: income accumulation
definition: Accrued income is not distributed and instead remains reflected within the unit/share price.

name: FundUnitDistributionMethod
label: fund unit distribution method
definition: The normal distribution policy for funds.

name: FundDebt
label: fund debt
definition: Debt issued by a Fund.
explanatoryNote: This would normally be held by participants in that pool. in this case the pool is a fund which is formed by each of the participants extending credit to that pool and holding bond units in the pool representing that debt.

name: EquityStakeInFund
definition: A stake held in a fund by way of a Share Class Unit.
explanatoryNote: Theoretically you can buy a fraction of a share in a fund. This would depend on the legal structure of the fund, e.g. a minimum investment. There is always a distribution plan.
label: equity stake in fund

name: CommonShareInFund
explanatoryNote: SR Review session notes: US: Closed and open ended funds may have common and preferred shares.
label: common share in fund
definition: A share unit in a fund, which is classified as a Common Share class.

name: PrivateEquityHolding
label: private equity holding
definition: A holding of private equity.

name: FundTransferAgent
definition: An entity that undertakes the execution of subscription, redemption and switch orders on behalf of a fund. Definition origin:EFAMA DD
label: fund transfer agent

name: OtherInvestmentFundInformation
definition: Things which are not part of the prospectus but are important if you want to understand the fund.
label: other investment fund information

name: JurisdictionStrategy
label: jurisdiction strategy
definition: Strategy which is jurisdiction based.

name: AnnualizedPerformanceDeterminationMethod
label: annualized performance determination method
definition: Annualized performance determination.

name: FundPortfolioInvestmentPolicy
explanatoryNote: ISO FIBIM: Rough allocation of the portfolio.
label: fund portfolio investment policy
definition: policy with respect to allocation of the portfolio that is designed to meet the stated investment strategy and goals

name: FundBondClassUnit
explanatoryNote: From EFAMA Review: called denominations e.g. issued in $5000 pieces. You cannot buy fractional amounts in a bond.
label: fund bond class unit
definition: A fund unit which takes the form of debt in that fund.

name: FundsProcessing
definition: The context of managing and processing funds, issuing funds units etc. This is the context in which the different parties involved in a fund are defined as parties.
label: funds processing

name: FundUnitHolding
definition: A holding of a unit in another fund.
label: fund unit holding

name: FundOrderDeskPhysicalFormDocument
definition: A phsyical form obtained through the main fund order desk.
label: fund order desk physical form document

name: EquityAsset
definition: The holding of equity securities in a portfolio.
label: equity asset

name: FundsCreation
label: funds creation
definition: SPV set up for fund management Conesnsus:Review

name: SICAV
label: s i c a v
definition: Societe Collective a Capital Variable

name: SICAF
definition: A French fund vehicle type. Designation and definition needed.
label: s i c a f

name: FundDepositary
definition: The party that holds and safeguards holdings owned by a fund. It is also responsible for compliance of the portfolio with legal ratios etc.
label: fund depositary
explanatoryNote: The depository may delegate custody to another entity (custodian). Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: FundsCashDistribution
label: funds cash distribution
definition: Accrued income is distributed periodically to the investor.

name: FundDistributionPolicy
explanatoryNote: Note that individual classes of Fund Unit also have specific distribution polcies as they effect that class of unit. This class is for terms with wording of the form: " ... whether or not it is possible to hold shares ..." for a given parameter.
label: fund distribution policy
definition: policy indicating the overall strategy or limitations on distribution for the fund

name: FundManagementCompany
label: fund management company
definition: The party that sets up the fund, decides the investment strategy, appoints the agents, and is responsible for the promotion and the marketing of the fund. It makes all of the important decisions related to the fund. Also called fund promotor or fund sponsor or fund manager.
explanatoryNote: In the US: operates on a percentage of the Portfolio assets under management.

name: GrossOfFeePerformanceDeterminationMethod
label: gross of fee performance determination method
definition: Performance determined gross of fee. Review: Is this mutually exclusive with the other listed method? It sounds like it is not.

name: CurrencyStrategy
label: currency strategy
definition: Strategy which is currency based.

name: MoneyWeightedRateOfReturnPerformanceDeterminationMethod
definition: Money weighted rate of return.
label: money weighted rate of return performance determination method

name: name
definition: Name of the investment fund.
label: name

name: fundClassTypeIdentifier
label: fund class type identifier
definition: A textual identification of the class of fund units. This is used to uniquely identify a particular class of fund units, and thereby identify features of this type of unit within the fund.

name: minimumInvestmentAmount
label: minimum investment amount
definition: Minimum amount that has to be invested in the specified strategy.

name: frontEndLoadApplicable
definition: Whether a front end charge on subscription orders for this class can be applied.
label: front end load applicable

name: exCouponDate
definition: The date at which the coupon is substracted from the NAV
label: ex coupon date

name: identifies.1
label: identifies
definition: Jurisdiction (country, county, state, province, city) of the investment.

name: declarationChannel
label: declaration channel
definition: Means of the net asset value publication, eg, a newspaper.

name: investmentFocus
definition: The information about the area the fund is mostly invested into (for example stock market in Germany).
label: investment focus

name: statedManagementFee
definition: The fee that is stated in the Prospectus as being what is to be charged for management. Further notes: Can be monetary amount or a percentage or a combination. Action: simple type is wrong.
label: stated management fee

name: maximumRedemptionFee
definition: Maximum percentage or fixed amount of money due when redeeming fund shares Definition origin:EFAMA DD
label: maximum redemption fee

name: maximumRedemptionPercentage
label: maximum redemption percentage
definition: Maximum quantity of securities, expressed as a percentage that can be sold.

name: trackingError
label: tracking error
definition: See RiskFactors narrative in EFAMA DD

name: productGroupDescription
label: product group description
definition: Company specific description of a group of funds.

name: firstAccountingYearEndDate
label: first accounting year end date
definition: Last day of the first accounting year for the fund.

name: includeRelatedFirms
definition: Whether or not the strategy includes firms which are related in some way to the referenced organization.
label: include related firms

name: firstNAVCalculationDate
label: first n a v calculation date
definition: The first date of NAV calculation

name: mainFundOrderDesk
label: main fund order desk
definition: Whether the fund order desk is the principal entity appointed by the fund to which orders should be submitted.

name: issuePrice
definition: The price at which the Fund Unit was first issued.
label: issue price

name: holderMayReinvest
definition: Whether or not the holder may reinvest dividends in the fund.
label: holder may reinvest

name: valuationFrequency
definition: Frequency of the net asset value calculation.
label: valuation frequency

name: statedInvestmentAim
definition: The stated aim of the Fund in words, e.g outperfom a given benchmark.
label: stated investment aim

name: redemptionDealingFrequency
definition: Frequency at which the redemptions are done.
label: redemption dealing frequency

name: processingCountry
definition: Country in which the processing characteristic applies.
label: processing country

name: valuationFrequencyTextualDescription
definition: Description of the frequency of the net asset value calculation.
label: valuation frequency textual description

name: initialApplicationForm
definition: Physical application form for the initial subscription by the investor.
label: initial application form

name: inceptionDate.1
definition: Authorization date in the country of origin. Further Notes See definition in Inception Date for Fund. Separate fact exists here. Same definition used. EFAMA Review notes: Inception Date exists as soon as there is a prospectus, so it is a fact about a Share Class even if the share class is never formally issued or offered to the public. Legal structure exists even if something is not launched. Editor question: Review stated this was a fact about Share Class; confirm this fact does not apply to Bond and Note units, or was the term Share Class being used to mean all three? Meanwhile I have put the term "Issue Date" as a fact about all Fund Unit, as this is given a sa separate term in the EFAMA DD spreadsheet. MAy come clearer in the next version of that.
label: inception date

name: dealingFrequencyDescription
label: dealing frequency description
definition: Description of frequency at which the subscriptions and redemptions are done.

name: reinvestmentFrequency
label: reinvestment frequency
definition: For units where there is Reinvestment distribution, the frequency with which the reinvestment takes place (this will be the same or less frequently than the Dividend Payment Frequency), otherwise this fact does not apply.

name: description.1
label: description
definition: Description of the benchmark used to determine the performance of a portfolio.

name: minimumRemainingHoldingUnits
label: minimum remaining holding units
definition: Minimum number of units/shares that must be retained to avoid automatic redemption.

name: accountingYearEndDate
definition: Last day of the accounting year for the fund.
label: accounting year end date

name: blacklisted
label: blacklisted
definition: Whether or not the strategy in framed so as to include the referenced business entity as being blacklisted. If yes, the strategy prevents investment in securities issued by that organization.

name: backEndLoadApplicable
definition: Whether an exit charge, eg, CDSC, on redemption orders for this class can be applied.
label: back end load applicable

name: redemptionInAmountAllowed
definition: Whether redemptions in amount are allowed.
label: redemption in amount allowed

name: maximumRedemptionAmount
definition: Maximum quantity of securities, expressed as an amount that can be sold.
label: maximum redemption amount

name: authorizedCountry
definition: Country in which it is authorised to commercialise the fund.
label: authorized country

name: statedObjective
label: stated objective
definition: The stated objective of the fund, in words.

name: redemptionForm
definition: Physical written instruction/renunciation form for redemption of units/shares by the investor.
label: redemption form

name: registrationDate
label: registration date
definition: The date at which the fund is legally approved in a country other than the country of origin.

name: subscriptionPeriod
label: subscription period
definition: Specific period, eg, for some guaranteed funds, during which the units/shares may be subscribed to.

name: minimumHoldingPeriod
label: minimum holding period
definition: Period, in days, during which the units/shares must be held following their issue before redemption will be permitted.

name: redemptionFee
label: redemption fee
definition: Actual percentage or fixed amount of money due when redeeming fund shares Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: limitedSharesAreIssued
definition: Whether or not new shares can be issued in the fund. This is what makes it a closed end or open end fund.
label: limited shares are issued

name: subsequentApplicationForm
definition: Physical application form for subsequent investments by the same investor.
label: subsequent application form

name: dualFund
definition: Whether the fund has two prices.
label: dual fund

name: minimumSubscriptionUnits
definition: Minimum number of units/shares that must be purchased by existing investors.
label: minimum subscription units

name: switchingFee
label: switching fee
definition: Actual percentage or fixed amount of money due when switching to another fund. Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: minimumInvestmentPercentage
definition: Minimum percentage that has to be invested in the specified strategy.
label: minimum investment percentage

name: redemptionCycleInBusinessDays
label: redemption cycle in business days
definition: The last business day following the day on which a redemption order is priced (T) by which settlement will be due for orders placed with the main Fund Order Desk. Alternatively, if proceeds will be paid following receipt of written renunciation, the last business day following receipt of the relevant renunciation documentation by the main Fund Order Desk (R) by which the proceeds will be sent.

name: legallyRecordedIn
definition: Relationship note: This relationship has no obvious parent; it is similar to Security legally recorded in Jurisdiction, but that inherits from Contract jurisdiction whereas a Fund is a Pool not a Contract. So the meaning is not the same. Assign parent relationship in future if a more general one exists; at present there is none.
label: fund legally recorded in

name: signatureRequired
label: signature required
definition: Whether a phsyical form with the investor's written signature is required through the main fund order desk. Yes:A phsyical form with the investor's written signature is required through the main fund order desk.

name: hasDataProvider
label: has data provider
definition: has an organization which is the data provider and is legally responsible for the information provided

name: valueAtRisk
label: value at risk
definition: See RiskClassification_NameOf in EFAMA DD Applies to Fund not Portfolio.

name: couponPaymentDate
definition: The date at which the coupon is distributed to the bond unit holder.
label: coupon payment date

name: physicalDocumentRequired
label: physical document required
definition: Whether a phsyical form is required through the main fund order desk. Yes: A phsyical form is required through the main fund order desk. No: A phsyical form is not required through the main fund order desk.

name: minimumInitialSubscriptionUnits
label: minimum initial subscription units
definition: Minimum initial number of units/shares that must be purchased.

name: minimumSubscriptionAmount
label: minimum subscription amount
definition: Minimum subscription value for existing investors.

name: performanceFee
definition: Fees paid for the achivements of predefined outperformance objectives Definition origin:EFAMA DD
label: performance fee

name: subscriptionsInAmountAllowed
label: subscriptions in amount allowed
definition: Whether subscriptions in amount are allowed.

name: additionalRestrictions
label: additional restrictions
definition: Other restrictions or treatment information in respect of this strategy and the organization to which it refers.

name: endOfFiscalYear
label: end of fiscal year
definition: Day and month on any given year at which the books are closed and profit and loss is determined.

name: holds
label: holds
definition: The Funds Special Purpose Vehicle holds this Fund.

name: maximumPurchasingFee
label: maximum purchasing fee
definition: Maximum percentage or fixed amount of money due when purchasing fund shares Definition origin:EFAMA DD

name: redemptionCutoffDateTime
label: redemption cutoff date time
definition: Last date/time at which an order to redeem can be given.

name: maximumInvestmentPercentage
definition: Maximum percentage that may be invested in the specified strategy.
label: maximum investment percentage

name: subscriptionDealingFrequency
definition: Frequency at which the subscriptions are done.
label: subscription dealing frequency

name: clearFundsRequired
definition: Whether cleared funds may be required before a subscription order can be executed.
label: clear funds required

name: minimumRemainingHoldingAmount
definition: Minimum value of units/shares that must be retained to avoid automatic redemption.
label: minimum remaining holding amount

name: hasIssueDate
definition: Date of first NAV calculation and start of performance calculations (same as launch date)
label: has issue date

name: switchingChargeable
label: switching chargeable
definition: Whether a switching charge for changing between sub-funds of the same umbrella can be applied.

name: redemptionPeriod
definition: Specific period, eg, for some guaranteed funds, during which the units/shares may be redeemed.
label: redemption period

name: percentageInvested
definition: The percentage of funds that is to be invested at any given time.
label: percentage invested

name: definesMainFundOrderDeskAccount
label: defines main fund order desk account

name: decimalPlaceRounding
label: decimal place rounding
definition: Number of decimal places to which quantities of units/shares are rounded.

name: launchDate
label: launch date
definition: Date of first NAV calculation and start of performance calculations

name: intendedLiquidationDate
definition: The date on which the SPV is scheduled to be disbanded and wound up.
label: intended liquidation date

name: mayAlsoBe
label: may also be
definition: The unit issuer would be the fund administrator (except when it is a Bond).

name: performanceDeterminationTimeframe
label: performance determination timeframe
definition: The timeframe on which the performance is reported (e.g. 1month, 1 year, YTD).

name: minimumRatingRestriction
definition: The minimum rating of securities to be invested in.
label: minimum rating restriction

name: maximumRedemptionUnits
definition: Maximum number of shares/units that may be redeemed on a single dealing day.
label: maximum redemption units

name: hasFundPolicy
label: has fund policy
definition: Overall policy for amounts invested, limitations etc. Not the same as the detailed Portfolio policy.

name: description
definition: The manner in which the manager tries to reach the funds objectives
label: description

name: purchasingFee
definition: Actual percentage or fixed amount of money due when purchasing fund shares Definition origin:EFAMA DD
label: purchasing fee

name: typeOfSecurities
label: type of securities
definition: The type of securities or other holdings that may be invested in.

name: minimumDeviation
label: minimum deviation
definition: Minimum allowable deviation from the benchmark.

name: distributionWithReinvestment
label: distribution with reinvestment
definition: It is possible to hold shares for which the accrued income is distributed, but then reinvested automatically in additional units/shares allocated to the investor.

name: benchmarkWeight
label: benchmark weight
definition: Instrument weighting in the benchmark for the portfolio.

name: subscriptionCutoffDateTime
label: subscription cutoff date time
definition: Last date/time at which an order to subscribe can be given.

name: inclusion
definition: Whether the referred strategy is included. No means this description refers to the exclusion of what is described, from the portfolio.
label: inclusion

name: maximumInvestmentAmount
definition: Maximum amount that may be invested in the specified strategy.
label: maximum investment amount

name: holdingTransferable
definition: Whether registered investors are able to transfer some or all of their holdings to third parties.
label: holding transferable

name: denomination
definition: Denomination Currency of the fund - Currency in which the fund unit is issued or redenominated and the currency of the NAV calculation.
label: denomination

name: minimumInitialSubscriptionAmount
definition: Minimum initial subscription value.
label: minimum initial subscription amount

name: name.1
label: name
definition: Name given to the defined strategy.

name: inceptionDate
label: inception date
definition: Authorization date in the country of origin.

name: maximumDeviation
definition: Maximum allowable deviation from the benchmark.
label: maximum deviation

name: historicPricingIndicator
definition: Indicates whether the price is historic or forward.
label: historic pricing indicator

name: hasDetails
label: has details
definition: Information on the net asset value calculation of the investment fund component.
